page.title: 09SOCIAL CONCERNS IN CODICOTE
page.content: There was much village controversy at the proposed sale by the County Council of the old school property to a private developer, because behind the attractive Victorian building was a fine playing field. This was felt to be public property and therefore this should have been retained as a village amenity to be used as a playing area. After losing an appeal the villagers continued to fight the developers' plan to build 80 houses on the site, which was considered gross over- crowding. This time they were partially successful as development was limited to 45 houses and a taste- ful modification of the school house into 6 homes. Many villagers still regret the loss of a fine old public building to the developers.
